page.title: 16SHOPPING IN RAMSBOTTOM
page.content: Most of the{shops}in Ramsbottom are in Bridge Street.This street was constructed after the diversion of a brook.It used to be known as Water Street. Rows of terraced houses were built along the street from 1820 to 1860.Most of these have since been converted to shops. Today there are about 37 shops, offices and buildings altogether ranging from bakers and butchers, to clothes shops and banks. Many of the businesses are{family-run} {concerns}and have been in the same family for over 100 years. In 1984 the Council granted permission for a small {market}to be set up behind Bridge Street. The smaller settlements around Ramsbottom do not have many shops and most of the residents travel into Bury to do their shopping.
